item.title: Improving Deep Neural Networks
item.description: Train/ Dev/ Test Sets Train Dev/ Cross-Validation Test Small Data 70% 15% 15% Big Data 98% (1 million) 1% (10,000) 1% (10,000) In real world application, we often do not have enough data and our models are data hungry. Its alright to collect Train data from multiple sources (e.g. Web Scraping when actual application deals with photos takes from a phone camera) and can be different from distribution different from dev/ test sets.

item.title: Introduction to Deep Learning
item.description:
Deep Learning refers to training of Deep Neural Networks (neural networks with several hidden layers). Deep Neural Networks basically automate the feature extraction step.
Neural Networks Takes input features, figures out functions to map it to output. Most commonly used function for this mapping is called ReLU (Rectified Linear Unit) function.
Supervised Learning with Neural Networks Examples Network Type Usage Example Input (x) Output (y) Simple NNN Housing Price Prediction House Features Price Convolutional NN Image Classification Image Class (Cat/ Dog) Recurrent NN Speech Recognition Audio Text Structured vs.
